Battery or Threat to a Witness

result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetrius Love was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Bribery of Public Official, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.10(1).
  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are waived.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Write a letter of apology to Deputy Evans and K.H. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Any assessments, counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Preliminary hearing on August 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Do not drive at all.  You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Demetrius Love in court with attorney Keith David O'Donnell.  Defendant Demetrius Love in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  
Defense moves to dismiss CT 3 based upon lack of probable cause. 
State does not object. 
BTC: Motion to dismiss CT 3 is granted.   Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
